citations: William C. Scott to Abraham Lincoln.

footnotes.text: 1James C. Louderman wrote the letter and bill of sale and signed the letter.

2William C. Scott sought, without success, to consign the carpet to someone travelling
                  directly from St. Louis toSpringfield, Illinois.Patrick CresapofJacksonville, Illinois, offered to take the carpet as far as Jacksonville, and left St. Louis with it on
                  the afternoon of May 7.  Upon arriving in Jacksonville, Cresap left it withMathew Stacy, who most likely delivered it to Abraham Lincoln.William C. Scott to Abraham Lincoln.
